III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require any Technical Assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require any Consultation.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 5 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: During
this reporting period, the facility has had 6 special investigations and 5 of the
investigations resulted in a CAP. The details of each of those investigations are as
follows:
• SIR 2023C0000422 dated 5/2/23 - CAP approved 5/10/23. Rule
400.4158(1)(a)(iv) due to a staff member using inappropriate language
towards a youth. Rule 400.4157(1) due to a staff member not following the
facility's behavior management policy.
• SIR 2023C0000490 dated 6/14/23 - CAP approved 6/27/23. Rule 4157(1)
due to staff not following a youth's safety/calming plan.
• SIR 2024C0000820SI dated 11/14/23 - CAP approved 12/1/23. Rule
4126(1) due to a staff member not following the requirements of 1:1
supervision for a youth.
• SIR 2024C0001020SI dated 1/18/24 - CAP approved 2/9/24. Rule
4158(1)(a)(iv) due to staff member being verbally abusive with two youth.
Rule 4158(1)(a)(ii) due to staff pulling and pushing a youth.
• SIR 2024C0001148SI dated 3/7/24 - CAP approved 3/15/24. Rule
4158(1)(a)(iv) due to a staff member using inappropriate language towards
a youth. Rule 4107(1)(c) due to a staff member not following incident
reporting procedures.
The facility has implemented and followed all CAP action steps sufficiently as
evidenced by quarterly CAP reviews completed by this Consultant.
Financial Overview
The facility's financial budget and financial audit were reviewed and there were no
noted concerns.

PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator (CA) reported the rate increase for staffing has really helped
with retention and hiring. CA noted calming plans for youth have improved
because staff members are putting more effort and thought into the plans, which
makes the plans more individualized. One continued area of concern for the facility
is access to comprehensive dental treatment for youth who require sedation as it
has been an ongoing barrier. Although all youth are currently up to date with their
dental appointments, there have been historical late appointments for youth who
require sedation to achieve dental cleanings at 6 and 12-month timeframes. During
the period of review, CA identified one unplanned discharge for a youth who
required hospitalization due to decompensation of behaviors. CA expressed some
concerns and frustrations with the upcoming MDHHS contract revisions.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Employee interviews were conducted. They all reported there is excellent support
amongst staff, leadership, and upper management. They all reported loving their
jobs and working with the kids. They reported leadership and upper management
are open to suggestions, feedback, and requests, so it creates an environment
with open communication and transparency. They reported concerns brought to
upper management's attention are addressed quickly, which is encouraging for
staff. They reported training is effective and they feel there is enough relevant
training to complete their job duties. They reported any changes in policy,
procedures, staffing, etc. are communicated quickly and effectively.
The youth interviewed did not have any concerns with the facility. They reported
the staff treat them well, they feel safe, they like the food, and they have enough
food.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walkthrough of the facility was completed on 3/19/24 and there were no safety
concerns noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
